title: CRISPR Repeat Element Detector
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR (Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats) repeat elements and related sequences in bacterial genomes. It shows sharp, distinct activation spikes precisely at CRISPR repeat locations (seen in sections 2, 0, 1) and CRISPR spacers (section 4), as well as near CRISPR-associated genes. The consistent spike-like activation pattern suggests recognition of the characteristic palindromic repeat structure of CRISPR elements rather than the broader genomic context. This feature likely recognizes the conserved sequence motifs or structural properties in CRISPR arrays that are critical for the bacterial adaptive immune system. The pattern is highly consistent across examples with CRISPR elements present, making it a reliable detector for these important genomic features involved in prokaryotic defense mechanisms.
